data.title: Manisha Koirala reveals reason behind her DIVORCE with Samrat Dahal
meta_keywords: manisha koirala samreat dahal divorce reason
data.meta_description: Manisha Koirala has opened up on her failed marriage and revealed the reason behind her divorce with Nepali businessman Samrat Dahal. The couple, who had married in June 2010, ended up parting ways in 2012.
data.text:
New Delhi:

Manisha Koirala has opened up on her failed marriage and revealed the reason behind her divorce with Nepali businessman Samrat Dahal. The couple, who had married in June 2010, ended up parting ways in 2012. It was indeed a tough time for Manisha, but the actress took up all the blame of the failed marriage and stated that it was her fault which led to her divorce with Samrat.

Manisha also stated that it is better to part ways that being in a bad relationship and that's what she did. She also averred that there was no fault from Samrat's end and she has no bitterness as well. "I had a dreamy idea of marriage. If you are in a bad relationship then it's better to separate. There is no bitterness," Manish told an entertainment portal. She further added, "I take full responsibility of hurrying up and wanting to get married and then realising I am not meant for this. There is no fault from other side, the fault is mine."

Also Read | Sanjay Dutt biopic: Manisha Koirala talks about playing Ranbir Kapoor's mother

On being quizzed about her plans for second marriage, Koirala stated that she isn't keen to get into a relationship again as she is content with her life. "At this point I am content with my life and my work. Let me live life like this for a while. We will see later (what to do)," Manisha added.

Manisha Koirala will soon be making her comeback in Bollywood with 'Dear Maya' where she plays the role of a middle aged woman who is looking for love. Besides, she will also be seen in Sanjay Dutt's upcoming biopic starring Ranbir Kapoor in the lead.

Manisha will be seen playing the role of Nargis in the movie, which also features Paresh Rawal, Anushka Sharma, Dia Mirza and Vicky Kaushal in the lead. Helmed by Rajkumar Hirani, Sanjay Dutt's biopic is expected to release by the end of this year.
